lines.content: You can use this to create a new todo task with a description.
You can use this to create a new deadline task with a description and a due by date.
You can use this to create a new event task with a description and a /from time and a /to time.
You can use this to list out all of the tasks, which will display if in order of and if it is marked as done.
You can use this feature to mark a task as done for good up-keeping.
You can use this feature to un-mark a task as done for good up-keeping.
You can use this feature to remove a task from the list.
You can use this feature to list out all of the tasks that match with a specified term.
All modifications using the aforementioned features will be saved to your device in a text file automatically.
Add a general task without a time frame.

Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Reads in the todo and stores it in a list and saves to the file.
Add a task with a deadlione.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Reads in the deadline and stores it in a list and saves to the file.
Add a task with a deadlione.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Reads in the event and stores it in a list and saves to the file.
Lists out all the entered in tasks and tasks loaded in at start.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Lists out all the taskst with their descriptions, times, and if they are marked done or not.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marked the task as done and displayed the marked task now denoted with '[X]'
unmark a task as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Marked the task as NOT done and displayed the marked task now denoted with '[ ]'
removes a task from the list from a specified index
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Deletes the specified task from the list. Echos what task it was. Resaves to the file because it was now changed.
lists out all the tasks that match a specified term.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Finds all the tasks that match the specified query and lists them out.

* Retrieves the task at the specified index in the list of tasks.
* @param idx The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* @throws DukeException If an error occurs while executing the command.
System.out.println("Please enter in a valid command.");
* Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the program should exit.
* @return A boolean flag indicating whether the program should exit.
* The Deadline object to be added to the list of tasks.
* The command word for a DeadlineCommand object.
* The description of the Deadline task.
* A boolean flag indicating whether the Deadline task is marked as done.
* The deadline of the Deadline task.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand object with the specified
* @param desc   The description of the Deadline task.
* @param isMark A boolean flag indicating whether the Deadline task is marked as done.
* @param by     The deadline of the Deadline task.
public DeadLineCommand(String desc, boolean isMark, String by) {
* Executes the DeadlineCommand by adding a new Deadline
* task to the list of tasks, printing a message to confirm
* the addition, and saving the tasks to the storage file.
* @throws DukeException If an error occurs while executing the command.
Deadline dL = new Deadline(this.desc, this.isMark, this.by);
* The keyword associated with the DeleteCommand.
* The index of the task to be deleted.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand object with the specified
* index of the task to be deleted.
* @param dIdx The index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the DeleteCommand by removing the specified task
* Also prints out a message indicating the task that
* was removed and the current number of tasks in the list.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the specified index is out of bounds.
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");

* Represents an EventCommand that is used to add an event to the task list.
* The Event object associated with the EventCommand.
* The keyword associated with the EventCommand.
* The completion status of the event.
* The start time of the event.
* The end time of the event.
* Constructs an EventCommand object with the specified description,
* completion status, start and end times of the event.
* @param desc   The description of the event.
* @param isMark The completion status of the event.
* @param start  The start time of the event.
* @param end    The end time of the event.
public EventCommand(String desc, boolean isMark, String start, String end) {
* Executes the EventCommand by creating a new Event object with the
* specified description, completion status, start and end times,
* adding it to the task list, and printing out a message
* indicating that the event has been added to the list.
* @throws DukeException if there is an error creating the Event object.
Event event = new Event(this.desc, this.isMark, this.start, this.end);
* ThRepresents the Exit Command that is used to terminate the program
* The keyword associated with the ExitCommand.
* Executes the ExitCommand by printing a farewell message and setting the isExit flag to true.
System.out.println("\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents the find command that extends the Command class*/
* The keyword associated with the FindCommand.
* Constructs a FindCommand object with the specified keyword to search for.
* @param term The keyword to search for.
* Executes the FindCommand by searching for tasks in the task list
* that contain the specified keyword and printing them out.
System.out.println("There are no tasks to search.");
System.out.println("\t Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
* Rerepsents a ListCommand that is sued to display all tasks
* The keyword associated with the ListCommand.
* Executes the ListCommand by displaying all tasks in the task list.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* The keyword associated with the MarkCommand.
* The index of the task to be marked.
* Constructs a MarkCommand object with the specified index.
* @param idx The index of the task to be marked.
* Executes the MarkCommand by marking the specified task as done.
* Saves the updated task list to the storage file.
System.out.println("\tNice! I've marked this task as done:");
* The string representing the command word for this command.
* The description of the new Todo task.
* The completion status of the new Todo task.
* @param desc   The description of the new Todo task.
* @param isMark The completion status of the new Todo task.
* Executes the ToDoCommand to add a new Todo task to the task list and save the changes.
* @throws DukeException If there is an error adding the new Todo task to the task list.
* Represents a Command to unmar a task
* The keyword that denotes the command to unmark a task*/
* @param idx Index of the Task in the TaskList to be unmarked.
* Unmarks a Task in the TaskList as not done yet.
* Prints the Task that has been unmarked and saves the updated TaskList to the storage file.
System.out.println("\tOK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Duke is a personal assistant chatbot that helps a user keep track of various tasks.
* The user can input tasks such as todo, deadline, and event, and Duke will manage them by adding, deleting, or marking
* them as done. Duke can also list all the tasks and find tasks that match certain keywords. Duke is able to save the
* tasks in a file and load them when the user runs the program again.
* A constant string that represents the line spacing used in the output.
* Creates a Duke object and initializes it with a Ui object and a Storage object.
* The storage object is created using the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path of the file that stores the task list.
* The main run loop of Duke. Displays a greeting message to the user and repeatedly prompts for user input,
* parsing the input into a command and executing it. The loop continues until the user types the "bye" command.
* The entry point of the Duke application.
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input and generating the appropriate commands for Duke to execute.
* Parses the given command and generates the appropriate command for Duke to execute.
* @return the appropriate command for Duke to execute
* Parses the user input and generates a FindCommand for Duke to execute.
* @return a FindCommand for Duke to execute
* Parses the user input and generates a ToDoCommand for Duke to execute.
* @return a ToDoCommand for Duke to execute
* Parses the user input and generates a DeadLineCommand for Duke to execute.
* @return a DeadLineCommand for Duke to execute
* Parses the user input and generates a DeleteCommand for Duke to execute.
* @return a DeleteCommand for Duke to execute
* Parses the user input and generates an EventCommand for Duke to execute.
* @return an EventCommand for Duke to execute
return new EventCommand(desc, false, start, end);

* @param input The user input containing the index of the task to unmark.

* Writes the given TaskList object to a file.
